intro: Cheiridopsis grandiflora, commonly known as the giant ice plant, is a succulent shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant features basal rosettes of thick, fleshy leaves that store water, enabling it to thrive in arid environments. It produces showy, yellow or orange flowers during the spring and summer months. Its adaptations make it well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping in dry climates.
